Emerging growth company &#168; &#160; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#168; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item 1.01 Entry into a Material Definitive Agreement. &#160; On September&#160;3, 2025, the Board of Directors of Tesla,&#160;Inc., a Texas corporation (the &#8220; Company &#8221;), approved an updated form of Indemnification Agreement (the &#8220; Indemnification Agreement &#8221;), and the Company entered into an Indemnification Agreement with each of its directors and executive officers (each, an &#8220; Indemnitee &#8221;). The Indemnification Agreement provides generally that the Company will indemnify each Indemnitee and advance expenses to each Indemnitee to the fullest extent permitted under Texas law, and to provide for continued coverage of each Indemnitee under the Company&#8217;s directors&#8217; and officers&#8217; insurance policies. The form of Indemnification Agreement is attached hereto as Exhibit&#160;10.1. The foregoing summary and description of the provisions of the Indemnification Agreement do not purport to be complete and are qualified in their entirety by reference to the full text of the Indemnification Agreement, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit&#160;10.1 to this Current Report on Form&#160;8-K and is incorporated herein by reference. &#160; Item 9.01 Financial Statements and Exhibits. &#160; (d)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Exhibits. &#160; Exhibit&#160;No. &#160; Description 10.1 &#160; Form&#160;of Indemnification Agreement. 104 &#160; Cover Page&#160;Interactive Data File (embedded within the Inline XBRL document). &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; SIGNATURES &#160; Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &#160; &#160; &#160; TESLA,&#160;INC. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; By: /s/ Brandon Ehrhart &#160; &#160; Brandon Ehrhart General Counsel and Corporate Secretary &#160; Date: September&#160;5, 2025 &#160; &#160; &#160;
